FuncDef:
The dhcp-server source command configures the source address of the packets sent by a DHCPv4 server group.
The undo dhcp-server source command restores the default setting.
By default, the source address of the packets sent by a DHCPv4 server group is the IP address of the interface that is connected to the upstream device.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the type of the interface.
-

Specifies the number of the interface.
-

Specifies the name of the interface.
-

Indicates that the source address of the packets sent by the DHCPv4 server group is the gateway address of the user address pool.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Through the dhcp-server source command changes the source address of the packets sent by the DHCPv4 server group.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
